alert.note: Alert for Bates; Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 05 at 12:11PM CDT until June 07 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Missouri... Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Osage River near Schell City affecting Vernon and Bates Counties. Osage River at Taberville affecting St. Clair County. For the Osage River Basin...including Schell City, Taberville... Minor flooding is forecast to continue. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Osage River near Schell City. * WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, flood waters impact all of the low lying areas in the Schell Osage Conservation Area as well as several county roads west of Schell City. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 31.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:45 AM CDT Sunday was 32.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 26.7 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 31.9 feet on 08/21/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. this afternoon at 115 PM CDT.
